p.s: The question is wetherwhether this speech might have an impact on the audience.

I personally think it depends on what the impact is aiming for because if it is spreading awareness and motivating people to the point where they feel a sense of responsibility then it is surely possible but if it the impact is supposed to be the immediate change, then I think it can be a bit more difficult.
Because looking realistically many politicians already made up their mind on this issue and it is more difficult to convince somebody on a political level rather thenthan on a personal level.
I'm sure this speech can be inspiring and motivating for some people especially with the statements that were being shown on a screen because they were able to identify with them.
But really having an impact will only show the actions.

We've already seen a similar situation with a speech from Leonardo DiCaprio at the Paris agreement and summit of the UNUnited Nations that is supposed to be motivating did not help enough to make an actual impact.
Because the only being aware of an issue does not fix it as long as nobody changes their approach on solving things.
